item.title: William add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "You would have to be half mad to dream me up." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: William add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: William add a quote by Charles mingus
item.description: " Making the simple complicated is commonplace; making the complicated simple, awesomely simple, thatâ€™s creative." -- Charles mingus

item.title: William add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: William add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore." -- Andre Gide

item.title: William add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description:
"I like the relaxed way in which the Japanese approach religion. I think of myself as basically a moral person, but I'm definitely not religious, and I'm very tired of the preachiness and obsession with other people's behavior characteristic of many religious people in the United States. As far as I could tell, there's nothing preachy about Buddhism. I was in a lot of temples, and I still don't know what Buddhists believe, except that at one point Kunio said 'If you do bad things, you will be reborn as an ox.'
This makes as much sense to me as anything I ever heard from, for example, the Reverend Pat Robertson." -- Dave Barry

item.title: William add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: William add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: William add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: William add a quote by Richard Hofstadter
item.description: "Tocqueville saw that the life of constant action and decision which was entailed by the democratic and businesslike character of American life put a premium upon rough and ready habits of mind, quick decision, and the prompt seizure of opportunities - and that all this activity was not propitious for deliberation, elaboration, or precision in thought." -- Richard Hofstadter

item.title: William add a quote by Niccolo Machiavelli
item.description: "If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared." -- Niccolo Machiavelli

item.title: William add a quote by Constantin Stanislavski
item.description: "Love art in yourself, and not yourself in art." -- Constantin Stanislavski

item.title: William add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: William add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: William add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "No one cares how much you know, until they know how much you care" -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: William add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Comparison is the thief of joy." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: William add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Wisdom.... comes not from age, but from education and learning." -- Anton Chekhov
